title.narrative: Dokan and Derbandikhan Emergency Hydro Power Project

description.narrative: The objective of the proposed project is to: (i) help alleviate the current power supply shortfall in the Kurdish region through urgent repair work; (ii) strengthen the capacity of local operational staff; and (iii) prepare for the subsequent rehabilitation of the Dokan and Derbandikhan hydropower plants. The reliability of both power plants is very low and the effective capacity of each has been as low as 50 percent. Subsequent rehabilitation would restore their original capacity of 400 and 249MW respectively.

title.narrative: Design and costing for assessed subsequent rehabilitation completed along with bidding documents.

target.value: Rehabilitation design and costing 100% completed and bidding documents ready.

comment.narrative: This is new indicator included through second restructuring approved in August 2012.

actual.value: Rehabilitation design and costing 100% completed and bidding documents ready.

comment.narrative: Capacity availability increase will be realized upon completion of full rehabilitation, especially through vibration & overheatingprevention works.

Based on on-going vibration assessment and prevention works, PMT has preliminarily announced that it is highly likely to achieveend-target by end-December 2013.***Actual (previous) section is blank as this indicator has been revised to better reflect theoriginal PDOs/indicators and implementation progress. Next ISR will reflect Actual (previous) progress indicator.***

title.narrative: Percentage of relevant staff trained in operation, maintenance and rehabilitation who pass the end program assessment.

baseline.value: 0% of relevant staff trained and passed an assessment.

target.value: 100% of relevant staff trained and passed the end program assessment.

comment.narrative: This is new a new indicator included through second restructuring approved in August 2012.

PMT is preparing a new training/ capacity building plan to accelerate the activity.***Actual (previous) section is blank as thisindicator has been revised to better reflect the original PDOs/indicators and implementation progress. Next ISR will reflect Actual(previous) progress indicator.***
Capacity availability increase will be officially confirmed upon completion of full rehabilitation, especially in switchyard.
To be officially confirmed in October 2013.

title.narrative: Percentage of relevant staff trained for operations, maintenance and rehabilitation (including various training programs implemented under repair contracts)

comment.narrative: This indicator has been revised to ensure that progress is better able to be monitored.

title.narrative: Excitation and control systems replaced; switchgear, dam intake structures, Derbandikhan dam slippage area, hydro-mechanical and substation equipment repaired.
